attributes.action: Stop the resale of baby essentials at high prices on selling sites.
attributes.additional_details: Times are hard for everyone at the moment. People bulk buying products such as baby milk and nappies which are essential for a babies care and selling on sites at three times the price is unethical and also problematic. Many can barely afford these items in the first place making them completely unobtainable now.
attributes.background: Stop websites like eBay allowing people to sell products such as baby milk and nappies at very high prices during the Covid-19 outbreak.

rejection.details:
The Government and Parliament are not responsible for the price of consumer goods.

We have published petitions calling for similar actions, which you might like to sign:

Introduce limits on per customer purchases in all supermarkets: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300766

Bring out ration books for food, everyday items and baby items: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/302823

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

NHS website: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

UK Government website: https://www.gov.uk/coronavirus
